1.title: Why Can't American Women Play Baseball

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: Women baseball players, coaches and experts share stories of over a hundred years of gender bias towards females in the US, and the complex social, cultural, and historical factors that continue to fuel the issue today.

2.title: Jim Crow Baseball

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: The mantra of "baseball is for boys and softball is for girls" is explored, exposing separate but unequal opportunities for American girls in baseball at every level of the game. Players and experts muse over the double-edged sword of softball as an avenue for a college education at the expense of girls and women wishing to develop as athletes in the game of baseball.

3.title: Ila

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: Meet Ila Borders, the most accomplished woman to play men's professional and collegiate baseball. Ila recounts her impossible dream of pitching against boys and men from Little League to the college and pro ranks.

4.title: The Only Ponytail in the Dugout

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: American female baseball players share stories of being the only girl on the field, dealing with magnified scrutiny, as having to be twice as good as males to be recognized and accepted as legit players and teammates.

5.title: Lilly

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: Mother and daughter explore the saga of a young girl's love of the national pastime and her skill as a hitter, causing dads in the stands to proclaim, "she's got a swing like Will Clark!" Lilly's journey takes her to the international stage and to Men's Division III baseball, where she becomes one of a just a few women in college baseball history to collect a hit. But there would be a price to pay.

6.title: A Game of Their Own

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

6.plot: American women celebrate making history playing in the All-American Girls Professional Baseball League in the 1940s and 50s to the 1990s with the Colorado Silver Bullets barnstorming team, international play and Baseball for All's annual girls' baseball tournament, the largest in the history of North America.

7.title: Cameron

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

7.plot: Ten-year-old third baseman Cameron Ely hates the color pink and is the only girl playing in her PONY league. She likes playing baseball "because I get to play with the boys and show them up!" Cameron's love of the game takes her to the national girls baseball tournament and to glory.

9.title: The Future

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

9.plot: Players and experts explore the future of US females in the game of baseball, and how change can be implemented to make the national pastime available to everyone at every level of the game.

1.title: Matt McGough - My first Day as a Yankee Bat Boy

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: New York Yankee bat boy Matthew McGough shares his first day working for the Bronx Bombers in the Don Mattingly era.

2.title: Mark Ulriksen - Baseball as Muse

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: Artist Mark Ulriksen expresses his love for baseball in world-class paintings.

3.title: Emma Amaya - Our Lady of Chavez Ravine

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: Emma came to the US from Honduras and fell in love with baseball and the Los Angeles Dodgers. Her die-hard love for the boys in blue resulted in fans voting Emma Dodger fan of the year in 2016.

4.title: My First Game/Player of the Week

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: Tiny Felder shares his first big-league at-bat and being named National League Play of the Week as a reserve outfield.

5.title: Doug McWilliams - The Rembrandt of Baseball Card Phtographers

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: Discover the legend of "the Rembrandt of baseball card photographers". Doug's lens has captured baseball history over six decades.

6.title: All-American Girls Pro Baseball League Pioneers

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

6.plot: Meet pitcher Maybelle Blair and utility fielder Shirley "Hustle" Burkovich, who played in the All-American Girls Professional Baseball League, aka "A League of Their Own." Now in their 80s and 90s, they travel the US advocating for girls and women to coach, play, or umpire baseball.

7.title: Perry Barber - The Arc of an Umpire

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

7.plot: Meet a former singer-songwriter who opened for Springsteen that's been umpiring around the world for almost forty years. Did we mention she's a woman?

8.title: Remembering Ernie Banks

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

8.plot: Sportswriter Ron Rapoport sheds light on the man behind the myth, Hall of Famer Ernie Banks.

9.title: 1970: A Brush with Radical History

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

9.plot: Nancy Finley, Oakland A's owner Charlie O. Finley's 12-year-old niece, discovers she's not in Kansas City after a move to gritty Oakland, CA.

10.title: Mudcat Grant - Breakfast with JFK

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

10.plot: Jim "Mudcat" Grant shares a story about a surprise invitation to breakfast by President John F. Kennedy in 1961.

1.title: Jackie Robinson: A Lion in Winter

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: Sportswriter Ron Rapoport pulls the curtain back on one of the last interviews #42 would give before his passing in 1972.

2.title: Masters of the Tools of Ignorance

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: Two generations of professional catchers present a master class in the art of catching, sharing stories of intimidating batters, home plate collisions, and the art of calling a game from behind the plate. Both share war stories and discuss the merits of the most underrated catchers to play in MLB.

3.title: Mudcat Grant - Baseball & Vietnam

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: World Champion pitcher Mudcat Grant shares his heart-warming story of a visit with a wounded soldier in Vietnam.

4.title: Steve Buechele - Song of the Bench Coach

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: The Texas Rangers bench coach and former third baseman shares stories of beanball wars, managing millennial ballplayers and his ten-year career as a stellar glove man.

5.title: Mudcat Grant - Raceball on the Inside Corner

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: Jim "Mudcat" Grant shares his remarkable story of besting racism in Major League Baseball in the 1950s and 1960s to become a world champion and one of the best pitchers of his era.

-1.title: For the Love of the Game

episode of.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (TV Series 2016– )

-1.plot: Women players, umpires, coaches and experts express their love for the national pastime. Laughter, tears and joy mix to paint a picture of hope and change for the future of baseball for American women.

Dodger Stadium - 1000 Vin Scully Avenue, Chavez Ravine, Elysian Park, Los Angeles, California, USA::(1000 Vin Scully Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90012)
AT&T Park, San Francisco, California, USA::(24 Willie Mays Plaza, San Francisco, CA 94107)
San Francisco, California, USA::(1800 Chestnut St, San Francisco, CA 94123)
imdb.plot outline: "The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories" is an original TV documentary anthology series featuring the human side of America's national pastime. It's the first TV series to capture the voices of those who weave the tapestry of baseball in America: coaches, players, bat boys, clubhouse attendants, umpires, fans, photographers, writers, artists, scorekeepers and more. The series also focuses on social issues like racism and gender bias, as well as examining the impact of art and literature on the game. War stories from former players and existing coaches add to a bold stew of inside stories that have never been told before.
imdb.title: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories
akas: The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories (United States)
plot: "_The Sweet Spot: A Treasury of Baseball Stories_ (qv)" is an original TV documentary anthology series featuring the human side of America's national pastime. It's the first TV series to capture the voices of those who weave the tapestry of baseball in America: coaches, players, bat boys, clubhouse attendants, umpires, fans, photographers, writers, artists, scorekeepers and more. The series also focuses on social issues like racism and gender bias, as well as examining the impact of art and literature on the game. War stories from former players and existing coaches add to a bold stew of inside stories that have never been told before.::Jon Leonoudakis
